author: wsjcom
title: Facebook, Personal Data and Common Sense
text:
In regard to Abigail Shrier’s “The Company That Loves Misery” (op-ed, April 12): I am in complete agreement until her final paragraph when she writes: “And now, Congress is calling on Mr. [Mark] Zuckerberg to fix the problem as if the problem weren’t Facebook itself.”
We are the victims of our own desire to be noticed, understood, consoled and cared about without the difficulties and time commitment of relationships grounded in reality. Why should Facebook be called the problem? We are the problem. Why must Congress be called...
